titles.title: Access to Life-Saving Trauma Care for All Americans Act
Access to Life-Saving Trauma Care for All Americans Act
To amend title XII of the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize certain trauma care programs, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 114-42.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 27.

action.text: Mr. Burgess moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 647.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 389 - 10 (Roll no. 113).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary:
3/16/2015--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)
Access to Life-Saving Trauma Care for All Americans Act
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize grants for certain trauma centers and grants to states for trauma centers through FY2020. The categorization of certain trauma centers is revised.
(Sec. 3) The Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response is given the authority to administer these grants.
